Alan Dean wrote:
> On 6/9/07, Mike Schinkel <mikeschinkel@...> wrote:
>> ... lots ...
>> Jon Hanna wrote:
>> ... lots as well ...
> 
> Question: Surely URL construction is orthogonal to REST?

Depends on just what you mean.

If by "URI construction" you mean "URIs are built according to some sort 
of sensible design" (I don't think either of us do) then it's largely 
orthogonal to REST but personally I think still a good thing.

If you're talking about types of hypertext that don't just give you a 
straight URI link but a way of constructing it (like templates or forms) 
then it fits so much within REST as to be largely an orthogonal matter - 
REST needs hypertext but not necessarily any particular form.

If you're talking about about clients "just knowing" how to construct a 
URI, which is what I would normally take "URI construction" to mean, 
then you're no longer orthogonal to REST, you're counter to it.
